analyzed: rgyu gcig yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu gcig pu yin pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúone cause‚Äù means the sole cause.

original: gcig gi sgra ni gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi sgra ni gtso bor gyur pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù is a term for the primary cause.

original: de yang dper na gzhu 'dzin pa ni srid sgrub gcig @12b pu yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o //üîΩdus kyi sbyor ba dman pa ni rang gi rang bzhin las nyams pa'o //üîΩlhag pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi rang bzhin las lhag par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dper na gzhu 'dzin pa ni srid sgrub gcig @12b pu yin no zhes zer ba lta bu'o // dus kyi sbyor ba dman pa ni rang gi rang bzhin las nyams pa'o // lhag pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi rang bzhin las lhag par gyur pa'o //
translated: For example, it is said that ‚Äúthe sole Arjuna is the wielder of the bow.‚ÄùüîΩThe inferior practice of time is the degeneration of one‚Äôs nature.üîΩThe excessive practice is the excess of one‚Äôs nature.

original: log pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi rang bzhin las phyin ci log tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i sbyor ba ni rang gi rang bzhin las phyin ci log tu byed pa'o //
translated: The incorrect practice is the opposite of one‚Äôs nature.

original: de yang dper na dman ba'i bsil ba dang ; dman pa'i tsha ba dang dman pa'i char ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o //üîΩdper na grang ba'i dus kyi gnas skabs su shin tu grang ba ni lhag ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang dper na dman ba'i bsil ba dang ; dman pa'i tsha ba dang dman pa'i char ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o // dper na grang ba'i dus kyi gnas skabs su shin tu grang ba ni lhag ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: For example, the application of cold, heat, and rain that are inferior is inferior application.üîΩFor example, in the context of cold weather, extreme cold is excessive application.

original: dper na lhag par bsil ba dang / lhag par tsha ba dang / lhag bar char 'bab ba ni lhag pa'i sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: dper na lhag par bsil ba dang / lhag par tsha ba dang / lhag bar char 'bab ba ni lhag pa'i sbyor ba ste //
translated: For example, excessive cold, heat, and rain are excessive application.

original: sbyor ba 'di gsum ni nad kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di gsum ni nad kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: These three types of application are the cause of disease.

original: mnyam pa'i sbyor ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sbyor ba ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: Balanced application is correct application.

original: rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ni nad med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin ji lta ba bzhin du gnas pa ni nad med pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Abiding in one's natural state is the cause of health.

original: yang don ni dbang po rnams kyi rang rang gi don dman pa la sbyor ba ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang don ni dbang po rnams kyi rang rang gi don dman pa la sbyor ba ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the application of each sense faculty to its inferior object is inferior application.

original: shin tu sbyor ba ni lhag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyor ba ni lhag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Excessive application is excessive application.

original: rtsub cing mngon par mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar gyur pa ni log pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rtsub cing mngon par mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i sbyor bar gyur pa ni log pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application to what is rough, undesirable, and so on is mistaken application.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las dman pa la 'jug pa ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las dman pa la 'jug pa ni dman pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Inferior application is the engagement in inferior actions of body, etc.

original: lhag par 'jug pa ni lhag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lhag par 'jug pa ni lhag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Superior application is the engagement in superior actions of body, etc.

original: bshang gci la sogs pa'i shugs 'gags pa dang / phyed tsam za zhing mang du smra ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa rang rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'og nas bshad pa rnams ni log pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bshang gci la sogs pa'i shugs 'gags pa dang / phyed tsam za zhing mang du smra ba la sogs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa rang rang gi bdag nyid kyis 'og nas bshad pa rnams ni log pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Erroneous application is the engagement in actions of body, etc. that are contrary to the Dharma, such as the cessation of the natural urges to urinate, defecate, etc., eating only half a meal, talking a lot, being overcome by desire, hatred, etc., as explained below.

original: thams cad kyang mnyam par 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyang mnyam par 'jug pa ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Correct application is the engagement in actions of body, etc. that are in accord with the Dharma, such as the performance of the four right efforts.

original: de bas na dman pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsum ni nad kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dman pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba gsum ni nad kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the three types of application, inferior, etc., are the causes of illness.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni nad med pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni nad med pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Correct application is the cause of health.

original: nad dang nad med pa'i zhes gang la bya zhe na /üîΩnad kyi nyes pa ma snyoms pa yin no //
analyzed: nad dang nad med pa'i zhes gang la bya zhe na / nad kyi nyes pa ma snyoms pa yin no //
translated: What is meant by illness and health?üîΩIllness is the imbalance of humors.

original: nyes pa snyoms pa nad med nyid //
analyzed: nyes pa snyoms pa nad med nyid //
translated: Health is the balance of humors.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in the following verse.

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams gcig gam gnyis sam gsum rang gi tshad las 'phel lam zad par gyur na /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams gcig gam gnyis sam gsum rang gi tshad las 'phel lam zad par gyur na /
translated: If the faults of wind and so on, one, two, or three, increase or decrease from their proper measure,

original: nad kyi rgyu yin pas nad nyid ni ma snyoms pa yin par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: nad kyi rgyu yin pas nad nyid ni ma snyoms pa yin par brtag par bya ste /
translated: then since they are the cause of disease, disease itself is to be understood as an imbalance.

original: rang gi rang bzhin las g-yos par gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin las g-yos par gyur pa yin la /
translated: It is a departure from one's natural state.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad ba'i nye bar gdags pas nad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu tha mi dad ba'i nye bar gdags pas nad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the designation of cause and effect as non-different, it is called 'disease'.

original: nyes pa rnams @13a * //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams @13a * //
translated: The faults

original: snyoms shing rang gi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur ba mnyam par gyur pa de ni nad med pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: snyoms shing rang gi rang bzhin las mi 'gyur ba mnyam par gyur pa de ni nad med pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: are balanced and do not depart from one's natural state. That is called 'health'.

original: tha mal bar rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha mal bar rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called 'abiding in the ordinary natural state'.

original: de'i dbye ba bstan pa ni //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba bstan pa ni //
translated: The teaching on its divisions is as follows:

original: de la nad ni rang bzhin gnas //
analyzed: de la nad ni rang bzhin gnas //
translated: Therein, disease abides in its nature

original: glo bur cha yis gnyis su bshad //
analyzed: glo bur cha yis gnyis su bshad //
translated: And is explained as twofold by its adventitious aspect.

original: ces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: de la zhes pa nad dang nad med pa de dag la nad ni rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i dbye bas gnyis su bshad do //
analyzed: de la zhes pa nad dang nad med pa de dag la nad ni rang bzhin du gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i dbye bas gnyis su bshad do //
translated: Here, those refers to the sick and the healthy. Sickness is explained as being of two kinds: natural and adventitious.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ni /
translated: Among them, the natural is

original: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa las byung ba'o //
translated: arisen from faults such as wind.

original: glo bur ba ni phyi rol nas 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: glo bur ba ni phyi rol nas 'ongs pa'o //
translated: The adventitious is arisen from outside.

original: de yang slob dpon gyis /
analyzed: de yang slob dpon gyis /
translated: Moreover, the Master [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] said:

original: nyes pa gsum las byung ba ni /
analyzed: nyes pa gsum las byung ba ni /
translated: Arisen from the three faults,

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa yin la /
translated: it is natural.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu las byung ba'i glo bur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu las byung ba'i glo bur ba yin no //
translated: Arisen from external causes, it is adventitious.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation.

original: 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi khyad par ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference between these two is as follows.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i nad rlung la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i nad rlung la sogs pa ni /
translated: The natural sickness of wind and so forth

original: dang po ma snyoms par gyur nas /
analyzed: dang po ma snyoms par gyur nas /
translated: is first an imbalance,

original: phyis zug gzer bskyed pa yin la /
analyzed: phyis zug gzer bskyed pa yin la /
translated: and later it produces pain.

original: yang glo bur ba ni dang po nyid du zug gzer bskyed nas /
analyzed: yang glo bur ba ni dang po nyid du zug gzer bskyed nas /
translated: Moreover, the adventitious produces pain from the very beginning,

original: der rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der rlung la sogs pa 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and then the wind and so forth are disturbed.

original: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i khyad par gyis phye ba'i nad 'di gnyis kyis sems kun tu gdung ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i khyad par gyis phye ba'i nad 'di gnyis kyis sems kun tu gdung ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that these two kinds of illness, distinguished as natural and adventitious, afflict the mind.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ltar lus dang sems ni nad kyi gnas nyid du gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ltar lus dang sems ni nad kyi gnas nyid du gnas pa yin te /
translated: Because the body and mind are the basis of illness in this way,

original: lus gcig bu'am sems gcig pu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lus gcig bu'am sems gcig pu ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not just the body alone or just the mind.

original: de bas na de'i rjes thogs la 'di skad ces bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rjes thogs la 'di skad ces bshad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, immediately after that, it is explained like this:

original: de rnams lus sems dbye ba yis //
analyzed: de rnams lus sems dbye ba yis //
translated: Those, by the division of body and mind,

original: gnas kyang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: gnas kyang rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The basis is also of two kinds.

original: zhes bya ba las yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i nad de rnams ni lus dang sems kyi dbye bas gnas rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba las yang rang bzhin gyis gnas pa dang / glo bur ba'i nad de rnams ni lus dang sems kyi dbye bas gnas rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: From that, the natural and adventitious illnesses are of two kinds of basis, by the division of body and mind.

original: rims dang / khrag dang / mkhris pa dang / lud ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni lus yin la /
analyzed: rims dang / khrag dang / mkhris pa dang / lud ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni lus yin la /
translated: The basis of fever, blood, bile, phlegm, and so on is the body.

original: myos ba dang / brgyal ba dang / sgyid lug pa dang / gdon dang / 'byung po dang / smyo ba dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas ni sems yin no //
analyzed: myos ba dang / brgyal ba dang / sgyid lug pa dang / gdon dang / 'byung po dang / smyo ba dang / dran pa nyams pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang la sogs pa'i gnas ni sems yin no //
translated: The mind is the abode of intoxication, fainting, laziness, demons, spirits, insanity, memory loss, attachment, hatred, and so on.

original: de yang 'di las gnas pas na gnas so //
analyzed: de yang 'di las gnas pas na gnas so //
translated: And since it is the abode of these, it is called the abode.

original: dris pa lus kyi nad skyed pa'i rgyu ni rlung la sogs @13b pa'i nyes pa rab tu 'khrugs pa yin par bshad kyi /
analyzed: dris pa lus kyi nad skyed pa'i rgyu ni rlung la sogs @13b pa'i nyes pa rab tu 'khrugs pa yin par bshad kyi /
translated: The cause of the arising of physical illness is explained to be the extreme disturbance of the humors of wind and so on.

original: sems kyi nad kyi rgyu gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi nad kyi rgyu gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of mental illness?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa ni /üîΩ'dod chags gti mug kyang yid kyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa ni / 'dod chags gti mug kyang yid kyi //
translated: Therefore, it is explained:

original: nyes pa gnyis su bstan pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa gnyis su bstan pa yin // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Attachment and delusion are taught to be the two faults of the mind.

original: yid ni sems la bya la /
analyzed: yid ni sems la bya la /
translated: The mind is the mental faculty.

original: de ni 'dod chags dang gti mug bde zhing ma rig pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: de ni 'dod chags dang gti mug bde zhing ma rig pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: It arises from attachment, delusion, and ignorance.

original: 'dir yang gtso bor gyur pas dang por 'dod chags smos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gtso bor gyur pas dang por 'dod chags smos pa yin no //
translated: Here, since it is the primary cause, attachment is mentioned first.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rlung la sogs pa yang nye bar bsdu ba'i don yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir de rnams kyang sems la brten nas /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rlung la sogs pa yang nye bar bsdu ba'i don yin te / gang gi phyir de rnams kyang sems la brten nas /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that wind and so on are also included.

original: rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Because they also cause transformation based on the mind.

original: dus dag tu rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang 'dus pa dang / dug gi rgyu las byung ba'i smyo nad drug yod pa yin no //
analyzed: dus dag tu rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang ldan pa dang 'dus pa dang / dug gi rgyu las byung ba'i smyo nad drug yod pa yin no //
translated: There are six types of insanity that arise from the causes of wind, bile, and phlegm individually, from their combination, and from poison.

original: bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshe'i rig byed kyi bstan bcos dag tu tshig gis mdo tsam du bstan gyi /
analyzed: bstan pa yin zhes bya ba ni tshe'i rig byed kyi bstan bcos dag tu tshig gis mdo tsam du bstan gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúAre taught‚Äù means that they are taught in the treatises on the science of medicine in just a few words.

original: rlung la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags dang gti mug gi mtshan nyid ma lus par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa bzhin du 'dod chags dang gti mug gi mtshan nyid ma lus par ni ma yin no //
translated: But they are not taught in their entirety, like wind and so on, with the characteristics of desire and ignorance.

original: 'dir rang bzhin gyis gnas kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'dir rang bzhin gyis gnas kyi mtshan nyid la sogs pas /
translated: Here, the characteristics of the naturally existing potential and so on are explained in their entirety,

original: rlung la sogs pa'am ma lus pa bshad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rlung la sogs pa'am ma lus pa bshad pa yin gyi /
translated: like wind and so on,

original: 'dod chags dang gti mug ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang gti mug ni ma yin no //
translated: but not desire and ignorance.

original: nad kyis bcom pa'i lus shes par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nad kyis bcom pa'i lus shes par bya ba'i thabs bstan pa ni /
translated: The method of understanding the body that is overcome by illness is taught.

original: nad pa blta dang rig pa dang // dris pa yis ni yongs su brtag / ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: nad pa blta dang rig pa dang // dris pa yis ni yongs su brtag / ces bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: The sick person is to be examined by sight, by touch, and by questioning.

original: nad yod pas na nad pa ste nad kyis gdungs pa'o //
analyzed: nad yod pas na nad pa ste nad kyis gdungs pa'o //
translated: The sick person is one who is afflicted by illness.

original: de ni blta ba la sogs pas yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni blta ba la sogs pas yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: He is to be examined by sight, etc.

original: de la blta ba ni mig gis te /
analyzed: de la blta ba ni mig gis te /
translated: By sight means by the eye.

original: mig ser ba la sogs pas nyam thag pa rnams la mdog ser ba dang / dkar por snang ba dang / dbyibs kyi tshad kyis 'phel 'grib dang / mdangs dang bshang gci dang / skyugs pa la sogs pas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: mig ser ba la sogs pas nyam thag pa rnams la mdog ser ba dang / dkar por snang ba dang / dbyibs kyi tshad kyis 'phel 'grib dang / mdangs dang bshang gci dang / skyugs pa la sogs pas brtag par bya'o //
translated: The sick person is to be examined by the color of his face, by the condition of his eyes, etc., and by the condition of his urine and excrement.

original: reg pa ni lag pa dang / lus kyi reg pas rims dang / skran dang / ma zhu bas nyen pa dang / de bzhin du grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / rengs pa dang / 'dar ba dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pas brtag pa dang /
analyzed: reg pa ni lag pa dang / lus kyi reg pas rims dang / skran dang / ma zhu bas nyen pa dang / de bzhin du grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / rengs pa dang / 'dar ba dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pas brtag pa dang /
translated: By touch means by the touch of the hand and the body. The sick person is to be examined by the touch of his limbs, joints, abdomen, etc. üîΩBy questioning means by asking about the present and past condition of the body, the nature of the illness, and the like.

original: dris pa ste gzer dang / yi ga 'chus ba dang / slon ba dang / lto sra ba dang / snyi ba dang / rmi @14a * //
analyzed: dris pa ste gzer dang / yi ga 'chus ba dang / slon ba dang / lto sra ba dang / snyi ba dang / rmi @14a * //
translated: The four kinds of indigestion are indigestion due to wind, indigestion due to bile, indigestion due to phlegm, and indigestion due to a combination of the three humors.üîΩ

original: lam du mthong ba dang / bsam pa dang / na tshod dang / nad kyi mgo gang nas zug pa dang / skar ma dang / mdza' bo dang / dgra bo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang / nad pa'i tshig las yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: lam du mthong ba dang / bsam pa dang / na tshod dang / nad kyi mgo gang nas zug pa dang / skar ma dang / mdza' bo dang / dgra bo dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang / nad pa'i tshig las yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: The following should be examined: the patient‚Äôs age, the time of day, the season, the year, the month, the fortnight, the day, the hour, the place, the direction, the nature of the disease, the nature of the patient, the nature of the food, the nature of the drink, the nature of the sleep, the nature of the conduct, the nature of the dreams, the nature of the thoughts, the nature of the age, the nature of the humor that is the head of the disease, the nature of the stars, the nature of the friends, the nature of the enemies, the nature of the happiness, the nature of the suffering, and so on, and the words of the patient.

original: nad kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i thabs bshad pa ni /
analyzed: nad kyi bye brag shes par bya ba'i thabs bshad pa ni /
translated: The method of understanding the specific diseases is explained:

original: nad kyi gzhi yi dang po'i tshul //
analyzed: nad kyi gzhi yi dang po'i tshul //
translated: The basis of the disease is the first principle.

original: mtshan nyid nyer bstan thob pa yin //
analyzed: mtshan nyid nyer bstan thob pa yin //
translated: The characteristics are taught to be obtained.

original: zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it says.

original: nad ni nad gzhi la sogs pa lngas yongs su brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: nad ni nad gzhi la sogs pa lngas yongs su brtag par bya ste /
translated: The disease should be examined by five things: the basis of the disease, the cause, the action, the time, and the place.

original: nad gzhi dang rgyu dang byed ba zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: nad gzhi dang rgyu dang byed ba zhes bya ba ni ming gi rnam grangs so //
translated: The basis of the disease, the cause, and the action are synonyms.

original: de yang nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yin la /
analyzed: de yang nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is of two types: proximate and distant.

original: nye ba yang nye ba dang shin tu nye ba'i dbye bas gnyis so //
analyzed: nye ba yang nye ba dang shin tu nye ba'i dbye bas gnyis so //
translated: The proximate is twofold: the very proximate and the proximate.

original: de la nye ba ni rtsub pa dang / yang ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa'i rdzas dang 'dres par gyur pas so //
analyzed: de la nye ba ni rtsub pa dang / yang ba dang / grang ba la sogs pa'i rdzas dang 'dres par gyur pas so //
translated: The proximate is that which is mixed with substances such as roughness, lightness, and cold.

original: shin tu nye ba ni dper na rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams gang dag gi rjes thogs nyid la nad 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu nye ba ni dper na rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa rnams gang dag gi rjes thogs nyid la nad 'byung bar 'gyur bas 'khrugs par 'gyur ro //
